meta.purpose: Comprehensive career profile from in-depth interview. Source of truth for resume-master.json, about page, resume builder AI context, and portfolio content. Never repeat this interview — update this file instead.

identity.tagline: Threat researcher who hunts, builds, and teaches.
oneLiners: 26-year-old Senior Threat Researcher who went from zero cybersecurity background to naming ransomware families, tracking APT groups, and delivering international workshops — in 3 years.
I find threats before anyone else knows they exist, build tools that turn 8-hour workflows into 30 minutes, and share what I learn through workshops and research.
I discover, I build, I teach. That's the cycle.
identity.whatDrivesMe: The investigation process — solving puzzles, connecting dots, discovering things nobody has reported yet. Finding that first instance of something new in the wild.
identity.builderPhilosophy: Having the IDEA is the most important aspect, and it can only come from experience. The real purpose is: how do I make this task easier? Generative AI helped level up execution, but knowing WHAT to build comes from doing the work.
characterTraits: Quick learner — completed a 2-year growth template in 1 year with zero prior background
Self-starter — built tools, pursued Gen AI adoption, and sought speaking opportunities without being asked
Persistent under pressure — survived an elimination-style 6-month training with zero failures
Problem-solver — every tool was born from a real operational pain point
Patient and thorough — willing to spend hours deep-diving malware samples and attack chains
Pragmatic — focused on outcomes and career growth, not just learning for learning's sake
Pioneer mindset — first on the team to adopt Gen AI, introduced AI-assisted reverse engineering company-wide
Knowledge sharer — naturally gravitates toward teaching and mentoring

careerGoals.openTo: Adjacent roles where job description aligns with existing skills, even if title differs
priorities: Company size (same or larger than Trend Micro)
careerGoals.companyPreference: Same size or larger than Trend Micro for better compensation and scope

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering
education.notes: Computer Engineering, NOT Information Technology. NOT University of the Philippines.

internship.organization: ICPeP (Institute of Computer Engineers of the Philippines)
internship.notes: Only prior experience before Trend Micro. No other cybersecurity foundation.

preCareer.programmingBackground: Had programming foundation from Computer Engineering degree, but not to the extent of what was built later. Learned to code specifically to solve operational problems at Trend Micro.

hired.title: Cybersecurity Threat Engineer
hired.method: Applied during mass hiring program. Passed exams and technical interview.

structure.evaluationSystem: 4 failure points. Module exam fail = 1 point, midterms/panel defense fail = 2 points, finals fail = automatic termination.
structure.examType: Practical exams — actual debugging, malware analysis, behavior identification with proof (parameters, registries, persistence, payloads). NOT multiple choice.
structure.panelDefense: Given a hard-to-debug sample. Must find ALL behaviors, present findings, answer panel questions covering entire execution chain.

topics: Win32, Win64 EXE, DLL, Linux, script files (JS, VBS, PowerShell)
Ransomware, backdoor, DLL sideloading, worm, trojan
Macros in Excel, malware in DOC, PDF, LNK files
Web threats (disease vectors, malware accomplice websites, classification)

performance.notes: No prior experience with assembly programming, debugging, or malware analysis before training. Achieved top ranking through intense interest in investigations and debugging.

threatHuntingStart.title: Threat Hunter / Threat Researcher
onboarding: Case handling immersion (malware tagging, detection, naming conventions, platforms, malware types)
OSINT training (VirusTotal, Malware Bazaar, Triage, ThreatFox, Twitter/X, Reddit communities)

promotionEligible.notes: Completed stage 2 of growth template in 1 year (normally takes 2-3 years). Was doing work comparable to senior colleagues. Year-end accomplishments exceeded those of senior peers. Promotion declined due to tenure requirement.

promoted.title: Senior Threat Researcher
newResponsibilities: Technical leadership — recommendations, suggestions, insights, advice
Leading all team projects and automations
Critical Events monitoring (representing PH team alongside Japan and Cork)
Mentoring and onboarding new team members
International training delivery (sourced due to lack of training team resources)
APT research report authorship for Vision One paid customers

growthTemplate.description: Trend Micro Threat Hunting Team growth framework. Stages: - (training), 0, 1, 2, 3.

two.title: Advanced
skills: Expert VT hunting + YARA rule sharing

three.title: Expert (Jacob was performing at this level before promotion)
skills: Generative AI coaching and project development

proactiveHunting.description: No cases assigned — fully proactive. Monitors dashboards, YARA rule triggers, VT queries for newly uploaded samples. Checks detection status across own product and competitors.
proactiveHunting.workflow: Find hash/indicator → check detection status → if undetected/new → full malware analysis → name ransomware if new (based on extension/ransom note) → create SPOT or noteworthy report → escalate to blog if warranted

yaraRules.description: Writes and maintains YARA rules himself. Learned on the team, not in training.
yaraRules.scope: Generic rules for different techniques + specific rules for monitored malware families
yaraRules.techniques: Behavior-based rules, not just string matching
yaraRules.dashboard: Built daily-refreshing dashboard for newly uploaded files matching rules. Modifications adopted team-wide.

internalHunting.description: Major career shift. Moved from OSINT-only to internal telemetry hunting.
capabilities: Log reading and analysis (distinguishing malicious from benign)
MITRE ATT&CK framework application (practical, not theoretical)
Distinguishing real infections from test machines, honeypots, red teaming
internalHunting.impact: Most published research stems from internal hunting. Led to ideas for tool building (log analyzers, dashboards, regex searches, automations).

inquiryHandling.description: Customer-facing teams send inquiry requests for threat hunting, coverage, and detection. Requestors: BU Managers, Regional Managers, Tech Support, Tech Marketing.
inquiryHandling.beforeTITAs: Everything manual. Could take a full week to resolve. Emails often ignored.
inquiryHandling.afterTITAs: Systematic triage, fast initial findings, structured follow-up. Notes what to do and where to look.
exampleTypes: Vague: 'Tell us about UNC3886' triggered by government announcement
Specific: 'Check these 14 IOCs for Oyster Backdoor coverage'

criticalEventsMonitoring.description: Represents PH Threat Hunting Team alongside Japan and Cork teams.
activities: Monitor newly uploaded email attachments/files with event keywords
Dark web and underground forum monitoring
Internal telemetry monitoring for event-correlated detections
Share findings with government partners (police, cyberdefense) and media

ransomwareSpotlights.description: Comprehensive reference publications on ransomware groups. Full MITRE ATT&CK mapping, attack lifecycle, victimology, infographics, defensive strategies.
ransomwareSpotlights.leading: Agenda Ransomware (Qilin) — has the most information on this group, monitored for years
ransomwareSpotlights.contributionSource: Part of threat intelligence/campaign building group. SPOT reports and noteworthy reports feed into spotlights.

aptTracking.description: Author for APT research reports distributed to paid Vision One customers and internally.
aptTracking.focus: Warlock Group and its relation to Chinese APTs
aptTracking.origin: Started from SharePoint CVE-2025-53770 analysis where Warlock abused the vulnerability
aptTracking.methodology: Higher Pyramid of Pain levels — infrastructure, TTPs, Diamond Model for threat attribution. Not just IOCs/hashes.

toolBuilding.description: Builds tools to solve real operational problems. Every tool born from a pain point.
toolBuilding.philosophy: Having the IDEA is most important — comes from experience. Gen AI helps execution.

skadi.problem: Searching many websites for articles with IOCs, then manually reading, extracting, verifying, summarizing, and creating CTI reports. Took 8 hours.
skadi.solution: RSS feeds with auto IOC detection, keyword/GPT/IOC scoring, auto-summarize, auto-retrieve hashes/IPs/domains, auto-check detections, auto-generate CTI JSON.
skadi.impact: 8 hours → 30 minutes. New recruits can now do in 30 min what took experienced analysts a full day.
skadi.adoption: Team-wide, primary analysis workflow. Absorbed into patent-protected larger project.

titas.problem: Customer-facing teams sending inquiry requests. Everything manual, took a week to resolve.
titas.solution: 9-phase AI pipeline: intake → OSINT → IOC merge → WRS → VT → response → VT complete → visuals → Confluence publish.
titas.impact: Week-long responses → same-day initial findings + structured follow-up.

vtAutomations.vtIntel: Automated daily VT searches for newly submitted malware. Predefined queries with time filters, enriched CSV output.
vtAutomations.vtExtension: Extended VT with behavioral analysis, file extension tracking, ransomware note extraction. Reduces testing workload, improves clustering.
vtAutomations.vtYara: Leverages VT YARA hunting notifications for real-time detection.
vtAutomations.feeds: ThreatFox, Malware Bazaar, Triage, RSS feeds — all automated collection and enrichment.

majorTools.confluenceTools: 13+ tools: RAG report gen, MAAS analysis, PPT analyzer, AI chatbot, BEC investigation, log analysis.
majorTools.mcpServers: OpenCTI connector (500K+ indicators), Obsidian vault CRUD, ImageGen via Gemini.
majorTools.claudeCodeApp: Desktop GUI for Claude CLI with autonomous pipelines, multi-model routing, 70+ models.

otherContributions: Introduced IDA Pro and Ghidra MCPs company-wide — sparked AI-assisted reverse engineering adoption across teams
Improved team hunting dashboard — modifications adopted team-wide
Various smaller automations for workflow optimization

mdrContribution.description: Shares hunting findings with MDR team for F.I.R.E. alerts to IR team and customer engagements.
mdrContribution.impact: Some contributions are critical finds that directly trigger incident response.

mentoring.description: Onboards new team members. Teaches internal hunting techniques, processes, SPOT report and noteworthy report creation.
mentoring.focus: SPOT reports and noteworthy reports — highest value skills for the team.

leadership.scope: All team projects and automations, threat intelligence building group

certifications.external: None — credential story built on published research, training delivery, and output

tcap.name: Trend Micro Certified Anti-Malware Professional Training

oneMonthMalware.name: One Month Advanced Malware Training
oneMonthMalware.topics: Same as AMT but deeply expanded over 30 days
oneMonthMalware.deliveredOnce: Internally for other teams in Taiwan

atd20x.name: Advanced Threat Defence Training 20X
modules: ATD 202: Cybercrime Operations and Attack Methodologies

international.participants: International cybersecurity professionals from different countries

international.notes: For other teams within Trend Micro

government.audience: DICT (Department of Information and Communications Technology)

external.title: From Attacker's Mindset to Defender Strategies
external.description: Replicating red teaming commands, transitioning to Vision One for defense and investigations. Created all content, CTF challenges, virtual environments, documentation, manuals, slides.
external.notes: Created the entire hands-on lab session. Also handled CTF events.

external.title: AI's Momentum in Cyber Threat Investigations
external.description: Usage of AI, hosting locally, advancing forensics capability — memory and disk forensics assisted by AI. Prepared everything: virtual environments, contents, documentation, manuals, slides.
external.notes: Invited back because they liked the 2024 presentation. Created all content for 2nd year.

external.description: Presented DECODE 2024 content (From Attacker's Mindset to Defender Strategies)

internal.description: Presented multiple times to the whole company
Presented projects and reports directly to directors

patent.scope: Threat intelligence building pipeline — from external reports to Vision One
patent.jacobRole: Most components created by Jacob (Skadi absorbed into larger project)

notablePublications: Cerber Ransomware (first blog — Confluence vulnerability connection)
CrazyHunter: BYOVD-Driven Ransomware Targeting Taiwanese Critical Sectors
Agenda Ransomware Group Adds SmokeLoader and NETXLOADER
Warlock: From SharePoint Exploit to Enterprise Ransomware
publications.uncreditedWork: Published blogs from Japan inquiries — info sourced from Jacob but not credited by name

genAIPioneer.description: First on the team to adopt and apply Generative AI to automations and tools — before senior colleagues.
genAIPioneer.impact: Introduced IDA Pro and Ghidra MCPs to the entire company, sparking AI-assisted reverse engineering projects across teams.

growthSpeed.description: Completed 2-year growth template in 1 year. Caught up to colleagues with 1 year head start. Year-end accomplishments exceeded senior peers.

trainingTopStudent.description: Top student of batch in 6-month elimination-style malware training. Zero failures. No prior background.
trainingTopStudent.notes: Not to be included in public profile per Jacob's request, but important context for understanding capability.

active.methodology: Diamond Model, infrastructure pivoting, TTP attribution

adaptixC2Hunting.description: Set up Adaptix C2 from source, fingerprinted defaults (404 page, response headers, ports, certificates), hunted using FOFA, identified 28 live C2 servers in the wild.
adaptixC2Hunting.technique: Default configuration fingerprinting → FOFA hunting → verification

coldriverLostkeys.description: Analyzed COLDRIVER/LOSTKEYS APT malware stages. Wrote custom YARA rules for Stage 1 (ClickFix) and Stage 2 (Anti-VM). Discovered new low-detection sample. Pivoted from known C2 via URLScan DOM analysis, used FOFA to find new C2 infrastructure (mobilizationcenter.com.ua).
coldriverLostkeys.technique: YARA rule creation → VT monitoring → URLScan pivoting → FOFA infrastructure discovery → DOM verification

cerberRansomware.description: First published blog. Traced attack chain from initial script → C2 connection → deobfuscated payload (PE file disguised as .txt) → identified as Cerber ransomware. Connected to Confluence vulnerability with team.
cerberRansomware.significance: First blog publication, initiated by Jacob

unc3886.description: Handled urgent Singapore BU inquiry triggered by government minister announcement. Produced comprehensive analysis that became a published blog.
